name: Intellikid
body:
### 2016 SLIIT Software Engineering WeekEnd batch group 011 The goal of these guidelines is to create uniform coding habits among software personnel in the IntelliKid development team so that reading, checking, and maintaining code written by different persons becomes easier. The intent of these standards is to define a natural style and consistency, yet leave to the authors of the source code, the freedom to practice their craft without unnecessary burden. All developers in the project must adhere to these coding practices. ## Variable Naming * Use all lower case letters * Use '_' as the word separator. * Global constants should be all caps with '_' separators. * Try to use meaningful names as much as possible. * All variables should be declared at the top of the class. ## Function Definitions * Function names should starts with a lowercase letter. * Use camel case style. * Name should be descriptive by itself indicating the purpose of the function. * Function definitions should adhere to the "BSD/Allman style" 
    function fooFunction($arg1, $arg2 = '') {
      if (condition) {
        statement;
      }
      return $val;
    }
Please note the placement of the curly braces. * Methods need to be marked with the access modifiers whenever needed * Overriding methods must use 
@Override
annotation above the method with a comment. ##Comments * C style comments (/* */) and standard C++ comments (//) are both fine. Use of Perl/shell style comments (#) is discouraged. * Place a comment in every custom class that used in the application. It should have 
@author
, 
@desc
and 
@created
annotations with a comment block. ##Arrays * Use the following format for associative arrays: 
$config= [
'name'=>'Yii',
'options'=> ['usePHP'=>true],
];
##Additional Rules * Control structures, methods blocks, classes and everything should be properly indented using tab spaces. * Single line if, while, for conditional blocks should use curly braces even though it is not mandatory in language.
